reviewText:
This is easily one of the worst zombie-themed games I've ever played.

Supposedly, developers tried to make something like a squad-based survival simulator. The final product is not a simulator, it's not about surviving (if we're not talking about user surviving through the UI), and squad-based part is just pontless.

Every aspect of the game represents raw incompetence of the developers -- game is bugged, UI is ridiculous, gameplay is extremely boring (if you'll last more than 1 hour, like I did, you're supposed to be awarded with a medal), fighting system is just plainly lame.

The game has active pause (you can prace Space to pause the game and give orders to your survivors). Presumably, this was implemented to introduce tactics to the game. Alas, this effort was fruitless -- fights are boring and repetitive. Most of the fights are ending up in user, luring enemies into some trap and then activating it. There's no tactics to it, honestly, it's just a waste of time.

There's a ton of useless mechanics. For example, your character can randomly start bleeding after he was wounded. You'll be bleeding for the whole duration of the level (it won't stop), yet you won't lose any HP for that. Why was that implemented? Because it attracts zombie in a bigger radius around you. But since you're walking faster then they do, they'll soon forget about you and would roam around their location aimlessly (pathfinding is awful here too, by the way).

The weapon system is plainly lame -- you can only hold 1 weapon, and if you want to turn on some switch, you first have to hide the weapon, then use the switch, then take out the weapon again. Developers couldn't care less about usability, I think.

One of the bugs that I've found in my short session was inability to launch game in windowed mode -- all my efforts lead to a point where my inventory disappeared alongside with all of the texts in the game. I was unable to fix it, so, obviously enough, I've decided to just uninstall.

Will I recommend this game? Never. I may recommend to try it to people with really low self-esteem that are enjoying UI masochism and poor gameplay.

I'd rate the game 2.0 out of 10.0, and would NOT recommend it to anyone.

reviewText:
A frustrating but overall nice turn-based/real-time strategy/RPG hybrid game.

The gameplay is very similar to Icewind Dale. You get to control a party of survivors in real-time, however you can pause the game at any moment to choose what should be that character's next action.

The action is very intense as you can often become overcrowded with dozens of zombies in just a mere few seconds. The feeling of the weapons, from baseball bats, pistols, to even grenades is perfect. Letting a zombie to slowly walk right up to your character's face to finally blow his/her brains out with a well timed shot is deliciously rewarding. The game world, characters and zombies are all well designed, but the voice acting is atrocious. The game is well presented, the graphics are good, but the camera system can be extremely frustrating to control at times. Getting used to the poor camera system and controls can be a hard task.

The game uses a checkpoint system to save your progress during missions, but they're quite rare and some checkpoints are optional. These are often placed in an alternate route and protected by a bunch of zombies. While the checkpoint system builds up tension and greatly increases the challenge, it only leads to frustration because you can easily loose an hour of gameplay if the game crashes (and it does often in some missions).

I would recommend to buy a 4-pack when on sale (or even better, get it in a 1 dollar bundle) to play with your friends because playing solo can be VERY tiring as you'd have to micro-manage everything.

There's no achievements in this game.

reviewText:
I think this game gets more abuse than it deserves and I think herein lays great potential for a new take on zombie games.  Not that I'm recommending this game on its potential alone.

Where there can be filler sections, there are a good smattering of genuinely exciting sections where you have to tactically micromanage your team's position, weaponry and targets to escape the hordes that are rolling inexorably over your position.  Cramped indoors or built up urban areas add to this excitement, where every move is key.  I found the game's difficulty relatively on the low side though (no difficulty settings either), and was never short of ammunition but the game is swift to punish carelessness as your guys can become zombie chow in 2 seconds if left unattended next to a hungry undead.

The story plays homage to all the zombie cliches in a suitably brief (only about 8 or so hours of gameplay so it doesn't outstay it's welcome) tour of all the standard zombie invasion locations.  There are rough bits granted, and it could be buggy at times.  I had at least one crash to desktop, and sometimes injured zombies would suddenly stand up many metres from where you had smashed/blasted them to.  Also there are some truly bizarre choices at times (the end credits ends on a box of cereal) and the ending was a bit of a flop, leaving me with a bit of an anticlimx as the only thing resembling a boss fight coming on the penultimate level.

I will allow there are better zombie games out there.  Though if you love all things zombies and tire of the standard run and gun zombie kill-a-thon then this could be the game for you.  Definitely pick it up on sale.

reviewText:
Okay, this is not a good game. This is A GREAT GAME! This game is AWESOME.

(READ IT IF YOU DID NOT LIKE THE GAME... this is SPOILER)

I was longing to play a zombie game that has slow moving yet scary zombies, and this gives me that. The environment is great, the difficulty is awesome. It doesn't throw countless zombies at you. The zombies are few, but tackling even two of them together can be dangerous. You got to keep devising plans to isolate each one so that you can kill it before another one reaches you.

CONTROLS
The controls are a bit clumsy. But it is not impossible to get used to. I took an hour to tap the right key/button. Main things in control are:-
- most control is mouse-centric
- after the first level, you control two or more players. So, you have to select the player you want to act as and perform the action.
- I couldn't read it mentioned anywhere, but it seemed like the characters got stronger in the skills you used them for, and some innate skills
- to save the game, you need to bring all the playable characters to the savepoint (manhole)

i rarely write reviews, and they are never this elaborate. But i was shocked to see only 36% positive reviews on a game that is one of the most realistic feeling yet fun zombie game I have played.

The game might be a repititive, but do you really expect to see Shakeera dancing for you in a zombie apocalypse game!

My opinion... get this game and push yourself for the first couple of hours... this might become one of the most absorbing games you have played... and yes, i have played it single player..

Avoid this game. I'm sorry but while I do love me some realtime isometric squad based tactics abnd the zombie story and characters seem interesting I have to say this game should be avoided. An example of a solid concept ruined by shoddy execution.

I'm sorry, at this point I cannot recommend this game. v1.1. I can't, I honestly can't.  I like the premise and what it's trying to do but the execution is in a word, sloppy. The interface should not be an obstacle to the game and unresponsive controles should not be part of the challenge.

When you sometimes have to click 3-4 times to get a character to even move, that is a recipe for frustration and disaster for while your shosen chracter will not respond the zombies around you will respond quite readily. Then there are the crashes., which are made doubly frustrating because the game uses a checkpoint system so you can lose a whole lot of progress, just because the game decided to crash. Did I mention that each save/checkpoint can only be used once per mission and there are usually no more than 4 for an entire mission? So you can't even mitigate the crash problem by 'saving frequently. It is also far too easy to accidentally drop an item from your inventory, which in the heat of a fight... can be a problem.

Overall, the game needs quite a few fixes and sadly those will have to be fan/community made since the devs have pretty much said 'nope we're done, enjoy'. Understand that when the game works, when the controls choose to respond and the game doesn't bother to crash... it is a good game...these moments arem at least for me (and quite a few others), few and far between. a textbook example of a good concept and good mechanics cripppled by poor implementation and interface.

reviewText: Trapped Dead is a below average tactical strategy game with lots of gory zombie goodness.  Unfortunately the title is marred by a multiplayer mode that appears non-functional, wonky camera controls and an exceedingly slow pace in the normal movement mode. Most frustrating about the title however is that your death will often be the result of the frustrating camera controls and not a a tactical error, and combined with a checkpoint save system almost guarantees frustration at certain challenging points in the campaign.  Altogether Trapped Dead disappoints and should only be picked up by genre collectors or die hard zombie enthusiasts.

reviewText: This game's had a lot of negative reviews but if you want some cheap and cheerful zombie meets axe to the head action it's not that bad.\nIt may be slow paced, it may feel a little bit on the dated side, and if you're looking for a story then look elsewhere, it's just a case of getting through the levels and finding ammo or the next survivor to join you, but it's a decent enough squad-based zombie fest all the same. Screenshots and reviews don't do it justice, the graphics are ok, nothing outstanding but acceptable, the gameplay is simple enough ( select a squad member then click where you want him to go and which way to face him). inventory is a basic affair but you can swap items between characters. Tactics aren't too involved, mainly choosing when to run and use stamina (which you also need for melee attacks) or stand and shoot with your limited ammo. I found the best way was to lure the zombies towards a squad member then get another character behind them with a bat or, even better, an axe and then thwack 'em. First aid is administered using the doctor with med packs but these are in limited supply, pistols, shotguns, grenades, all the usual suspects are there.\nThere aren't too many pickups so ammo is scarce at the start, a few more things to find (and maybe chests etc) would've been a nice addition, levels can feel a bit sparse except for the zombies and some loot locations, instead of stuff lying around, would have given it and extra degree of gameplay. All the negatives aside it's a fun enough game if you just want some relaxed undead bashing.....always a good thing in my opinion !

reviewText: This game's had a lot of negative reviews but if you want some cheap and cheerful zombie meets axe to the head action it's not that bad.\nIt may be slow paced, it may feel a little bit on the dated side, and if you're looking for a story then look elsewhere, it's just a case of getting through the levels and finding ammo or the next survivor to join you, but it's a decent enough squad-based zombie fest all the same. Screenshots and reviews don't do it justice, the graphics are ok, nothing outstanding but acceptable, the gameplay is simple enough ( select a squad member then click where you want him to go and which way to face him). inventory is a basic affair but you can swap items between characters. Tactics aren't too involved, mainly choosing when to run and use stamina (which you also need for melee attacks) or stand and shoot with your limited ammo. I found the best way was to lure the zombies towards a squad member then get another character behind them with a bat or, even better, an axe and then thwack 'em. First aid is administered using the doctor with med packs but these are in limited supply, pistols, shotguns, grenades, all the usual suspects are there.\nThere aren't too many pickups so ammo is scarce at the start, a few more things to find (and maybe chests etc) would've been a nice addition, levels can feel a bit sparse except for the zombies and some loot locations, instead of stuff lying around, would have given it and extra degree of gameplay. All the negatives aside it's a fun enough game if you just want some relaxed undead bashing.....always a good thing in my opinion !
